abstract: A key that specifies whether the device is a game controller synthetic HID device.
overview:
## Discussion

This key is present with a Boolean value of `true` on all game controller synthetic HID devices that the Game Controller framework creates.

If your app needs to exclude these synthetic HID devices from discovery by [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/iokit/iohidmanagerref], [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/iokit/1514494-ioservicegetmatchingservices], or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/iokit/1514362-ioserviceaddmatchingnotification], include the [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/kIOHIDGCSyntheticDeviceKey] with a value of `false` in the matching criteria.

Your code can check whether an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/iokit/io_service_t] or an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/iokit/iohiddeviceref] refers to a game controller synthetic HID device by querying the value of the [doc://com.apple.gamecontroller/documentation/GameController/kIOHIDGCSyntheticDeviceKey] property.

items.description: Learn how macOS brings support for the latest game controllers to software that predates the introduction of the Game Controller framework.
items.name: Understanding game controller backward compatibility

sections.title: Game Controller framework migration from IOKit

title: kIOHIDGCSyntheticDeviceKey
